intro: Hippotis multiflora, commonly known as the hairy leaf geranium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its hairy, serrated leaves and clusters of small, pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and long blooming period. Hippotis multiflora is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
